intro: Phagnalon calycinum subsp. carolipaui, commonly known as the Carolipaei phagnalon, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually narrow and sometimes hairy, and it produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
